steps.title: Launch Invoify website
details: User opens browser and navigates to https://invoify.vercel.app/en

steps.title: Dashboard loads
details: Page finishes loading and auto-redirects to dashboard view

steps.title: Verify header branding
details: User inspects header; Invoify logo is present and visible

steps.title: Screenshot dashboard
details: User captures proof of logo in header

steps.title: Locate “Bill From” section
details: Scroll/scan to find sender-information form area

steps.title: Focus on Name field
details: Clicks into the Name input inside “Bill From”

steps.title: Confirm Live Preview updates
details: System briefly fails then retries; “zeeshan” appears under sender name in real-time preview

steps.title: Screenshot completed form
details: User captures final state showing successful update

emotional_arc: User starts confident and curious. Quick, successful logo verification builds trust. Slight anxiety arises when Live Preview momentarily fails to update, but automatic retry resolves it and restores confidence. Overall feeling ends positive but with a hint of concern about responsiveness.

qualitative_opportunities.why_it_matters: Initial load took ~8-11 s each run. Long, silent waits erode trust and can cause abandonment.
next_actions: Implement code-splitting and asset compression to reduce TTFB and JS payload
Display a branded skeleton loader or progress indicator to reassure users during load

qualitative_opportunities.why_it_matters: Validation initially failed and needed a retry; real users may think the feature is broken or their input didn’t register.
next_actions: Investigate debounce / state-update timing for preview component
Provide micro-feedback (spinner or subtle shimmer) while preview updates

qualitative_opportunities.why_it_matters: Users must visually scan to find the sender form; unclear hierarchy can slow task completion.
next_actions: Increase heading weight or add iconography for major invoice sections
Add in-page navigation / sticky sidebar allowing quick jumps to sections

qualitative_opportunities.why_it_matters: Reinforcing successful actions increases user confidence and satisfaction.
next_actions: Highlight changed preview field momentarily (e.g., fade-in highlight)
Consider a small checkmark or toast confirming field synced to preview

qualitative_opportunities.why_it_matters: URL includes /en but no visible language switcher; users may wonder how to change language.
next_actions: Auto-detect locale and prompt user if different language is available

first_tackles.description: Fix Live Preview delay and add micro-loading state to avoid perceived failures.
Introduce a lightweight skeleton loader during the 8-11 s initial page load to keep users reassured.
Make invoice sections (e.g., “Bill From”, “Bill To”) more prominent with stronger headings or icons for faster scanning.
Add subtle success feedback (highlight or checkmark) when form fields successfully sync to preview.
